paragraph_text: V6 Freight Management provides simultaneous information and functions to everyone in the
Online booking, searching, printing and export of data. Upload and download of data files of transport consignments/manifest, warehouse receipt/shipping request & shipping labels.
Option to review/apply additional fees & charges. Approve for invoicing & print tax invoice. Apply cash receipts & email invoice/statement.
Visibility of freight by tracking of drivers/ storeman. Track temperature, signature, image or photo proof of pickup/delivery. Item level tracking by barcode or RFID (optional), click
Standard report tool & library. Custom report capability. Output to PDF, CSV, EXCEL, etc.
Support the latest Chain of Responsibility compliance legislation by NHVR with Fit For Work Declaration, Electronic Work Diary and Vehicle Pre-Check, click
Online quote Calculator, auto/manual rating of freight handling, movement & storage charges. Rate utility to manage all customer rates (copy, increase, etc.).
, drivers, etc.). Create manifest (manual or auto based on route). Allocate & dispatch to drivers/ storeman.
Option to review and apply driver/ subcontractor fees and charges. Approve for payment. Print Invoice/ statement or RCTI.
Standard dashboard for DIFOT (Delivery In Full On Time), Customer Stats (Number of Calls, Type, etc.). Optional BI tool & app available.

“V6 enables thousands of customers to manage,  store & ship their freight seamlessly though our valued carrier network.This capability ranges from small local regional transport to large national organisations.”

"We engaged Phoenix Express Logistics in July 2015, since then they have worked with us in presenting and subsequently utilising the many benefits of v6. Their ability to understand our business needs and adapt to the ever-changing requirements of the Rexel business has been impressive. We now consider Phoenix to be our Preferred supplier within Queensland which will expand interstate into 2019. v6 has enabled us to provide our customer with a much more fulfilled experienced".
Rexel Group State Operations Manager - QLD
No upfront costs, affordable fees, based on actual
users and activity levels. We provide hosting, back-ups and system administration. Deployment on multiple devices is easy and automatic.

V6 provides the tools and systems to run and grow your business.
The document is to provide an instruction to access v6 Invoice APIs.
The following are available API interfaces. Customers will be provided an API key in order to access the APIs; also, each API key is associated with a valid v6 CUSTOMER_SERVICE or CUSTOMER_ROLE user.
V6 provides the tools and systems to run and grow your business.

"First Express Couriers Started using the Omnix solution in late 2011 and offered this industry leading web based IT platform to all clients ensuring complete transparency across the supply chain and the ability to track consignments, invoices & Proof Of Deliveries. In addition, it has assisted our customers to book and label their freight more efficiently and produce a manifest for all consignments shipped.
V6 has enabled First Express Couriers to more than double volumes booked online over a four year development period, to over 6 million consignments during the past 5 years.

Our Customers & Customer Service Team have complete access and visibility to all freight movements through our network. V6 provides logging, tracking, & escalation of all customer queries with meaningful business intelligence & statistics.

During 2018 we rolled-out 60+ mobile devices to track and provide real time visibility & workflow to Customers, Operations & Drivers. The Omnix solution provides First Express Couriers with a ‘Best in Market’ IT solution driving growth in our business.”
In January 2015 the Phoenix Logistics Group embraced an opportunity to transform our business from the traditional paper consignment to an V6 online technology with the Omnix Group presenting v6.

With unwavering support from the Omnix staff, the transition period was swift and efficient, with all stakeholders -operational staff, drivers and customers - embracing the move and from there, our business has blossomed from a small group of elite customers through to today where we have over 300 customers enjoying the many modules within v6.

For us, the major change over recent years has been the ability to offer our customers a non-stop shop for all their logistical requirements which includes the integration of our three (3) 3PL warehouses located throughout SEQ that automatically link into the Freight Management System.

The ability for our Operational Teams across multiple sites to be in touch with the fleet via GPS tracking, transparency of warehouse stock movements by customers and interaction with end users via email alerts are just a few of the features which have enhanced our service offering in the industry.

The most notable benefit of v6 has enabled us to secure major contracts, in particularly the Rexel Group Australia. With over 200 branches Australia wide, the Rexel Group now have the ability to integrate their front counter staff directly into the v6 3PL stock holdings at any time, we then automatically despatch orders, provide pre-delivery advice and services across branches.

"We engaged Phoenix Express Logistics in July 2015, since then they have worked with us in presenting and subsequently utilising the many benefits of v6. Their ability to understand our business needs and adapt to the ever-changing requirement of the Rexel business has been impressive. We now consider Phoenix to be our preferred Supplier within Queensland which will expand interstate into 2019. v6 has enabled us to provide our customer with a much more fulfilled experience."
said David Farley Cook - Rexel Group State Operations Manager - QLD
Rexel Group Australia now represents one of our Major Accounts - I have no doubt our partnership with Omnix has been a key contributor to the success of this relationship.

Throughout the past 4 years, the requirements for support from Omnix has always been met with swift responses in addition to their flexibility to develop specific requests to enhance our customer's experience.

As our business expands, v6 grows with us as a strategic partner within the ever changing logistics industry where technology offerings are now one of the major requirements when presenting our valued services - v6 ensures we are at the negotiation table when it matters!
V6 Item level tracking – what are the benefits? Here’s what our tracking specialist has to say:

“By tracking the location, condition, transit status, delivery data and corresponding consignment details, you are able to provide to your customers a vast amount of information about any item being shipped. In real time. Your business benefits from this capability because there is no time wasted on resolving disputes, finding missed freight, explaining delays or defending damages. And because customers can find this information for themselves, it also assists with cash flow because sign-on glass signatures prove that payment is due. It’s a customer service no-brainer.”
Omnix V6 can help you achieve superior customer service and enjoy an enviable reputation in the industry.
Welcome to the V6 Blog, where you will find news and information about our products, people, innovations and achievements!

Migrating to Omnix V6 has been simplified and automated for those customers with legacy data. We offer a choice between two types of import services when it comes to transferring existing Masterfile data to your new V6 deployment:
• The users (including client customers) can import certain Masterfile data type information for free.
• The fields we import are listed in the Client Templates which we supply on request.
• If you’re using software from a competitor, we may be able to convert Masterfile data from your old FMS system.

• While we can convert most Masterfile data, it is dependent on the quality and completeness of your old database, as well as what your current software can export in a usable format (.xls, .csv, .txt, or .xml).

• To request a Masterfile data import, please discuss with Omnix support or our professional services team. We will provide you with directions on how to send us your Masterfile data. Once received, one of our software Specialists will consult with you and schedule a Masterfile data conversion date.

To automate the exchange of data between Omnix V6 and Barlinka, Omnix has developed a set of Web APIs and Keys which are yours to access.

This web service enables different software to communicate with each other; provides flexibility and enables a faster, more efficient exchange of electronic documents such as Inbound, Outbound warehouse orders, Consignment uploads, POD’s and Invoices.

Essentially, APIs are comparable to B2B, however they enable any system to connect with one another without the challenges found in B2B implementation and management. APIs have several benefits that make it ideal for use in the transport and logistics industry, which include the following:
API provides real-time data. Real-time data lets users see real time tracking.
It reduces the barriers to data retrieval including from legacy systems, APIs can interact with multiple systems due to their universal character.
API is also a cloud-based technology, so it can be maintained and updated without disrupting business operations.
It is fundamental to data analytics.
To request access to the Omnix API’s, please discuss with Omnix support or our professional services team. We will provide you with directions on access and use.

Omnix V6 is strategically positioned to be the cornerstone of a highly flexible, and configurable best-in-breed software solution. By this we mean a solution where you choose from the best products in the market to suit your needs and where V6 interfaces seamlessly with your selection.
The basis for this approach is an

, where our customers are empowered to introduce into their business the software that works best for their needs. They do this at their own pace and price point, and on the basis of expert interfacing and data integrity.
The table below illustrates some of the quality products we already work with, in addition to over 70 other interfaces already in our portfolio.
Contact Omnix today for details on 3rd party solutions & API’s.
In response to Chain of Responsibility (CoR) legislation, Omnix V6 is able to provide the following functional enhancements enabling you to meet the heavy vehicle compliance requirements.
The most significant enhancement is the availability of an electronic work diary (EWD), which will meet the safety accreditation levels established by NHV regulators.
This electronic work diary allows your operators and drivers to:
Complete an online fit-for-work form, also configurable to suit your business.
Record driving breaks, with options to setup alerts and timestamps according to your established break times.
The scheduling of Drivers to vehicles and loads also need to take fatigue management and driver hours into account.
V6 has a development application pending approval for EWD from NHVR.
For more information, please refer to the NHVR (National Heavy Vehicle Regulator) website
To enjoy the benefits of this Omnix V6 functionality, simply download the V6 Mobile Driver App from Google Playstore (Android owners) and Apple iTunes (iPhone/iPad owners).
In response to Chain of Responsibility (CoR) legislation, Omnix V6 is able to provide the following functional enhancements enabling you to meet the heavy vehicle compliance requirements.
The most significant enhancement is the availability of Vehicle pre-check and defect (repair request) information, which will meet the safety accreditation levels established by NHV regulators.
The Vehicle pre-checks are entirely configurable according to your organisational and vehicle context. Some examples of the checks include;
– check Tyres are correctly inflated, Condition and depth of the tyre tread & wheels are secure.
– check Brake failure indicators, Pressure/vacuum gauges, Air tank drain valves are operational.
– check Lights, including the clearance lights are operational, Reflectors and lenses are present and in good condition.
– check Fluid levels (oil, water, refrigerant/coolant, hydrolic/brake fluid).

The Defect (driver repair requests) report are freeform and allows the driver to record any issues prior, during or at the end of his shift. This information can also be used as part of the Defect maintenance work that needs to be performed during scheduled services or repairs (subject to nature & urgency).
– Tyre (driver front) damage to thread and might be delaminating.
– Fluid leaking (oil, fuel, water, refrigerant/coolant, hydraulic fluid, brake fluid or other) from the vehicle (excluding condensation from air conditioning or the refrigeration system)
Vehicles must regularly be maintained, and if speed limiters are fitted that they are functioning properly.
To enjoy the benefits of this Omnix V6 functionality, simply download the V6 Mobile Driver App from Google Playstore (Android owners) and Apple iTunes (iPhone/iPad owners).
In response to Chain of Responsibility (CoR) legislation, Omnix V6 is able to provide the following functional enhancements enabling you to meet the heavy vehicle compliance requirements.
The most significant enhancement is mass & dimension limits (capacity checking), which assist with meeting the safety accreditation levels established by NHV regulators.
Capacity checking is available in V6Dispatch when manual or auto allocation occurs of freight to a manifest and vehicle:
he maximum weight is the carrying capacity of the vehicle, usually in kilograms (kg), but could be tonnes as well. The unit must be the same as what will be used to quantify the freight.
The maximum volume is the volumetric capacity of the vehicle, usually in cubic meters (m3). The unit must be the same as what will be used to quantify the freight.

The maximum pallets is the number of pallet spaces capacity of the vehicle, in units of each. This assume a single(1) stack configuration, without the aid of pallet racking or double or triple stacking.
The maximum items is the number of units (containers, drums, skids, etc.) capacity of the vehicle, in units of each.

Other constraints are there purely as information and will not generate any alert or message at the time of creating a load plan or allocation of freight. This includes Maximum Height, Width, Length, Internal Height, Tailgate and Crane.
Drivers moving freight containers must have valid Container Weight Declarations.
Loads must be appropriately restrained with appropriate equipment.

It is important to note that other constraints such as driver to vehicle, trailer to vehicle, etc. are not controlled and operators must ensure license and capacity constraints are matched in this area.
Over 55% of supply-chain organisations still to adopt digital practices.

In a recent global research study of how supply-chain organisations are responding to the consumer-led, on-demand economy, Zebra reports that overwhelmingly, automation is becoming the gold standard for competitiveness.
Yet, 33% of businesses still use pen and paper to manage their third-party logistics, and only half of postal, courier and freight organisations are operating electronically.

And, if you consider that in 10 years time it is predicted that 97% of deliveries will be completed by a semi-autonomous vehicle, where the driver completes online administration while in the field, its not difficult to see that adopting innovative technology is not only desirable, it’s essential for survival.
So what management tools are becoming more standard around the world?

Zebra reports that currently, only 50% of organisations handle their freight documentation electronically, and 46% have a transport management system. For tracking, only 45% of businesses have a capability, growing to 100% by 2028.
From our perspective, no gains will ever be made in this disruptive landscape unless the underpinning technology platform enables open systems, interfacing and broad-scale integration.
to see how our open systems and a best-of-breed approach could set you up for the digital world.
Seamlessly automating the transport and logistic industry.

This API interface can be used to create a new consignment in v6. Also, customers can choose to create warehouse orders or not for the new consignment. In order to create warehouse orders for the new consignment, it requires providing the information for highlighted/orange fields in the table in Appendix A, some which are required to create warehouse orders; please read the description to see if which fields are required for creating warehouse orders or not.

Authentication: ApiKey, embedded in the request header. In details, the request header must contain a key value pair for the authorization; in which the key should be “Authorization” and value is “ApiKey
JSON request example: to see all fields please have a look at Appendix A
Note: all fields with empty or null value should be removed from the request.
Example creating a new consignment without warehouse order.
"specialInstructions": "Sail past the coral reef at Bjorn's point",
"note": "Please ensure all paperwork is kept sealed and waterproof",
Example JSON creating a new consignment with warehouse order:
The response will be returned in JSON format. The following are the list of some common responses.
the reference supplied by the call or generated by v6
Authentication problem: no API key found in the “Authorization” in request header, or wrong API key. This may provide different warning messages.

"msg": "Unauthorised: Cannot find API key in the header or the API key is not correct. Make sure the API key is embedded in the request header, under Authorization property. E.x. Auhtorization: apikey provided-api-key"
There are some constraints that submitted data must follow, for example some malformed data errors but not all:
string value exceed maximum length or shorter than minimum length,
number is smaller than minimum value or larger than maximum value
and some other logical constraints (e.g. pickup date must be before delivery date).

All the requests breaking the these rules will result in Bad Request (400). The corresponding responses also contain intuitive error messages informing which fields do not follow which rules. To see all rules please see appendix A.
The format of bad request response should look like following JSON
"connoteDate - wrong format - the date format should be yyyy-MM-dd",
"receiverSuburb - required field - must exist and must not be empty",
"connoteNo - invalid length - number of characters should be less than 40",
"receiverState - required field - must exist and must not be empty",
"vehicleType - invalid vehicle type - cannot find vehicle type ATLR1",
"senderState - invalid state QLD1 - Must be a legitimate State",
"senderPostcode - invalid postcode 40321 - must be a legitimate Post postcode",
"senderSuburb - invalid suburb CHERMSIDE1 - Must be a legitimate Post suburb",
"customer - invalid customer code 0013 - must be an existing customer code",
"chargeTo - invalid value SENDER1 - must be one of the following values: SENDER, RECEIVER",
This API interface is for retrieval of ONE consignment.
Param: {id}: the consignment id OR consignment reference  (id is preferred).
If consignment reference with special characters is used, those special characters must be %25-url encoded. Example: REF/K becomes: REF%25%2FK
Response: same as data required in creating consignment.
This API interface is for retrieval of stage of ONE consignment.
NOTE: Excessive use of this API can slow down the v6. To receive stage update, v6 has built-in scheduled jobs to send stage update to other systems. Contact the transport company to arrange this.
Param:{ids} the consignment Id, separated by comma (,)
"item": "BDLE", /*the item code in the consignment details line*/
"location": "ACACIA RIDGE", /* the location of the depot */
This API interface is for uploading POD files from external systems to V6
connoteId: document id of the connote
contentType: content-type of the POD (png, jpeg, pdf, tif are supported)
podDate: must be in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm (date of signaure, pod)
stage: POD (set consignment to POD stage)
rawData: POD data in base64 encoded.
This API interface is for retrieving a quote from V6. It is similar to book a consignment but only return the price.
This API interface can be used to create a new manifest in v6.
